4-2-4-2-0:
1. Plant-based meat alternatives will continue to gain popularity as more people become aware of the negative environmental impact of animal agriculture. This trend will be driven by a combination of concerns about animal welfare, climate change, and personal health.

2. Companies will increasingly adopt sustainable and renewable energy sources, such as solar, wind, and hydroelectric power, as they look to reduce their carbon emissions and become more environmentally responsible. This trend will be driven by a combination of regulatory pressure, consumer demand, and the falling cost of renewable technologies.

3. Single-use plastics will continue to be phased out in favor of reusable and biodegradable alternatives. This trend will be driven by a combination of concerns about plastic pollution, the availability of more sustainable alternatives, and the adoption of more stringent waste management policies.

4. Urban farming and community gardening will become more popular as people seek to grow their own food locally and reduce their carbon footprint. This trend will be driven by a combination of concerns about food security, the desire to eat healthier, and the desire to be more self-sufficient.

5. Eco-tourism will continue to grow as people prioritize sustainable and socially responsible travel. This trend will be driven by a combination of concerns about the environmental and social impacts of tourism, the availability of more sustainable travel options, and the desire to have authentic and meaningful travel experiences.

This trend will be driven by a desire to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and support sustainable food systems.

3. Greater focus on eco-friendly products 🌿🌱🌸. Boomers will be excited to see a proliferation of products made from sustainable materials, such as organic cotton and recycled plastics. Brands will also tout their environmental credentials, highlighting their use of eco-friendly practices in production and packaging.

4. Increased investment in green infrastructure 🌳🌿🌻. Boomers will be pleased to see more cities and communities investing in green infrastructure, such as green roofs, rain gardens, and permeable pavement. These types of infrastructure help to absorb and filter stormwater, reducing the burden on traditional infrastructure and providing numerous environmental benefits.

5. Growing awareness of the importance of biodiversity 🐝🦋🐢. Boomers will be heartened to see a greater appreciation for the role that biodiversity plays in supporting healthy ecosystems. This trend will be driven by a growing understanding of the many ways that biodiversity supports human well-being, including providing food, medicine, and natural beauty.
